text: I work daily with Python 2.4 at my company.
I used the versatile logarithm function 'log' from the standard math library, and when I entered log(2**31, 2) it returned 31.000000000000004, which struck me as a bit odd.
I did the same thing with other powers of 2, and it worked perfectly.
I ran 'log10(2**31) / log10(2)' and I got a round 31.0
I tried running the same original function in Python 3.0.1, assuming that it was fixed in a more advanced version.
Is it possible that there are some inaccuracies in mathematical functions in Python?
